newsitem.title: UK: Lloyds TSB makes more pensions provision.
newsitem.headline: Lloyds TSB makes more pensions provision.

text.p: Lloyds TSB Plc said it has made a further 50 million stg provision in its first half accounts for possible redress to customers who may have been mis-sold personal pensions.
The new amount takes Lloyds TSB's total provision for pensions to 250 million stg.
It made the announcement in its half-year results, which showed a 33 percent rise in pre-tax profits to 1.504 billion stg.
Banks and insurance companies who may have wrongly advised customers to leave occupational schemes in the late 1980s and early 1990s have offered to match the benefits the customer has lost.
The total industry-wide bill could rise to well above 4.0 billion stg previously estimated by insurers, according to industry estimates.
